paragraphs.body: It is a widely accepted standard that should normally be followed by all editors.

paragraphs.body: Article layout is to a large extent standardized on Avatar Wiki. Sections and their headings should largely be consistent across broadly similar categories of articles. In addition, all articles should have lead sections that summarize the subject of an article, unless otherwise stated, and the applicable infobox template if one exists.
paragraphs.text: Article layout is to a large extent standardized on Avatar Wiki. Sections and their headings should largely be consistent across broadly similar categories of articles. In addition, all articles should have lead sections that summarize the subject of an article, unless otherwise stated, and the applicable infobox template if one exists.

paragraphs.body: In general, these sections should appear in this order if they are needed in an article:

paragraphs.body: The word "the" should never be used to start a heading (i.e. "Battle" should be used instead of "The Battle") unless it is the beginning of an episode name (e.g. "The Puppetmaster").
